section.title: Sage Examples
section.p: Here are some Sage cells where you can do certain things that you cannot do so easily with a graphing calculator. Throughout the term I will add Sage examples from class here.

paragraphs.title: Solve a Linear System
paragraphs.p: Note the doulbe equals sign for making a comparison. Also note that multiplications must be explicit: 2*x, not merely 2x.

paragraphs.title: Row Reduce Matrices
paragraphs.p: First you must have a line that defines what kind of matrices you will work with. The QQ stands for the rational numbers, so these matrices will accept rational numbers as entries. You see 2 and 3 because we will make a 2\times3 matrix. The echelon_form() command gives reduced row echelon form.
